while(T){
    coeffs = sample(c(-9:-1,1:9),9)
    pows = sample(rep(0:2,3))
    cnts = c()
    lins = c()
    quas = c()
    for(i in 1:length(pows)){
        if(pows[i]==0){
            cnts = c(cnts,coeffs[i])
        }
        if(pows[i]==1){
            lins = c(lins,coeffs[i])
        }
        if(pows[i]==2){
            quas = c(quas,coeffs[i])
        }
    }
    A = sum(quas)
    B = sum(lins)
    C = sum(cnts)
    if(abs(A)<10 && abs(A)>1 && abs(B)<10 && abs(B)>1 && abs(C)<10 && abs(C)>1 && length(unique(abs(quas)))==3  && length(unique(abs(lins)))==3  && length(unique(abs(cnts)))==3 ){
        break
    }
}

pn = function(coeffs,pows){
    ex1 = paste0("{",coeffs,"}x^{",pows,"}",collapse="+")
    ex1 = gsub("+{-","-{",ex1,fixed=T)
    ex1 = gsub("{1}x^{0}","1",ex1,fixed=T)
    ex1 = gsub("{-1}x^{0}","-1",ex1,fixed=T)
    ex1 = gsub("{1}x","x",ex1,fixed=T)
    ex1 = gsub("{-1}x","-x",ex1,fixed=T)
    ex1 = gsub("x^{0}","",ex1,fixed=T)
    ex1 = gsub("x^{1}","x",ex1,fixed=T)
    ex1 = gsub("+-","-",ex1,fixed=T)
    return(ex1)
}

ex1 = pn(coeffs,pows)

ach = -9:9
sol1 = paste0(1*(ach==A),collapse="")
sol2 = paste0(1*(ach==B),collapse="")
sol3 = paste0(1*(ach==C),collapse="")
al = paste0("* ",ach,collapse="\n")

Question
========

Consider the function below.

$$f(x)~=~`r ex1`$$

By combining [like terms](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Like_terms#Example), we can create a simplified [quadratic function](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quadratic_function) in standard form.

$$f(x)~=~ax^2+bx+c$$

Find the values of $a$, $b$, and $c$.

* $a=$ ##ANSWER1##
* $b=$ ##ANSWER2##
* $c=$ ##ANSWER3##


Answerlist
--------

`r al`
`r al`
`r al`


Solution
========

Combine the quadratic terms. The quadratic coefficients are \{`r paste0(quas,collapse=" , ")`\}, and their sum is `r A`.

$$`r pn(quas,c(2,2,2))`~\equiv~ `r A`x^2$$


Combine the linear terms. The linear coefficients are \{`r paste0(lins,collapse=" , ")`\}, and their sum is `r B`.

$$`r pn(lins,c(1,1,1))`~\equiv~ `r B`x$$


Combine the constant terms.  The constant coefficients are \{`r paste0(cnts,collapse=" , ")`\}, and their sum is `r C`.

$$`r pn(cnts,c(0,0,0))`~\equiv~ `r C`$$

Thus, we can write the function in standard form.

$$f(x)~=~`r pn(c(A,B,C),c(2,1,0))`$$

We can now identify the values of $a$ and $b$ and $c$.

$$a=`r A`$$
$$b=`r B`$$
$$c=`r C`$$
